Job Title: Director of Operations

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
(The hiring company is confidential. Company name will be revealed in second step of the hiring process)
Are you a seasoned Director of Operations that has experience implementing EOS within a business?
Do you have experience and passion working in an ecommerce business?
Is the start up environment your comfort zone?
This role is perfect for the Integrator that loves to bring structure and can visualize a roadmap of systems that will allow the company to operate more efficiently. Team leadership is another key component of this role. You will have a direct impact on cultivating the culture within the company. This culture is one that has super clear communication with 100% open door to management. Everyone on the team knows their exact role and responsibility, and they should feel part of a mission that is bigger than themselves.
You are perfect for this role if you have experience with the EOS system. Gino Wickman has a permanent place on your bookshelf, and you continually refer to Traction and Rocketfuel throughout your career. The CEO is the Visionary and you are the Integrator that will take over the machine that executes marketing and fulfillment. This will allow the CEO to get out of the day-to-day and focus on innovation and growth of the company. You are decisive, always forward thinking, and a strong leader with effective conflict management skills. Now is the time in your career to go all-in with one opportunity. 
If you score 100% Integrator on the Rocketfuel test (or close to it), and this kind of work excites you, then this role might be perfect for you! 
Responsibilities (tasks associated with the role)Team Management and DevelopmentManage and lead team members to achieve goals, assessing resource needs, sourcing and managing project-based contractors as neededManage agencies ensure KPIs are achievedLead full hiring process and cycle for new team members as needed. Including recruiting and onboarding.Conduct regular employment reviews with each team memberDevelop internal training programs for internal useConduct team meetings OperationsImplement and manage an EOS system within the businessIntegrate all major operating functions of the businessEnsure thorough communication throughout the organizationCreate and automate (where possible) systems for the day-to-day activities of the business to simplify and streamline effortsCreate and write SOPS for all areas of the business, and keep SOPs up to dateRegularly analyze business systems and processes and implementing changes as neededPartner with the CEO to execute the business plan and achieve growth and revenue objectivesTrack key metrics for business activities to measure the effectiveness of efforts and give strategic guidance to move the company forwardForecast, manage and troubleshoot supply chain issuesAnalyze and improve the customer experience in every area of the businessCustomer ServiceAnalyze and improve the customer experience in every area of the businessOptimize software to improve customer retention and mange CS repsSocial MediaLead the creation and implementation of social media channels and strategies, utilizing team members as necessary.
Requirements (expected proficiencies to excel in this role)This position is for a person who is:Experience working with an ecommerce companyEOS Certified or equivalent working experienceExceptional written and verbal communication skillsDetail-orientedDecisiveAdaptive self management skillsExcellent at planningStrong, provide leadership and management skillsEffective conflict management skillsAccountableStrong interpersonal skillsOrganizedAdditional requirements:Access to a computer Reliable internet connectionReliable and distraction-free work environmentThis position is NOT for someone who:Prefers a slow-paced work environmentDoes not have experience with ecommerce
Software Utilized by CompanyKlaviyo, Go High Level, Gem Pages, Shopify, Trello, Slack, Telegram, Skype, Google Workspace, Dropbox, Microsoft360, GoDaddy
Current Team MembersCustomer Service, Assistant, Fulfillment House, Media Buyer, Developer, Designers, Branding Contractor, Amazon launch team, Email Agency
Offer DetailsThis is a full-time, remote, employee position. Pay is between $90,000-$100,000/year (based on experience). Benefits include:Healthcare allowancePaid HolidaysPTOUp to $75/mos cell phone credit

Experience Level (if available): None
